required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Breakfast Knowledge, Beliefs, and Habits of Exercising Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Breakfast Knowledge, Beliefs, and Habits of Exercising Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being done to determine typical breakfast consumption habits in various populations of exercisers. Participants will be asked a series of questions pertaining to their participation in regular exercise, their current breakfast consumption, food preferences, meal timing, and general knowledge of sports nutrition and pre-exercise breakfast consumption.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants will complete a one-time survey regarding breakfast habits and beliefs and sports nutrition knowledge, as well as the type, frequency, and intensity of exercise engaged in on a weekly basis.

primary_outcome.description: Questions asked include typical composition of breakfast, such as Meat, Plant-based protein (beans, lentils, peas), Nuts or seeds, Cheese, Eggs, Yogurt or dairy, Bread, Starchy vegetables, Non-starchy vegetables, Grains, Fruit/fruit juice, or Protein/meal replacement bars
questions regarding typical breakfast consumption habits
questions regarding how individuals felt about eating breakfast
questions from the 49-SNKI to assess sports nutrition knowledge
questions on frequency, duration and intensity of typical exercise sessions

arm_group.description: those who identified as participating in athletic competitions at DI, intramural, club or competitive levels
those who did not identify as participating in athletic competitions at DI, intramural, club or competitive levels

intervention.description: survey asking questions regarding breakfast habits and composition, sports nutrition knowledge and exercise habits

study_pop.textblock: anyone with a valid Ohio University email address or who saw the advertisement on social media who was older than 18 and participates in structured exercise

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18+ years old
- regular exerciser
Exclusion Criteria:
- younger than 18 years old
- do not regularly exercise
